00024 #ifndef _XENO_ASM_PPC64_ATOMIC_H
00025 #define _XENO_ASM_PPC64_ATOMIC_H
00026 
00027 #include <asm/atomic.h>
00028 
00029 static __inline__ void atomic_set_mask(unsigned long mask,
00030                                        unsigned long *ptr)
00031 {
00032     __asm__ __volatile__ ("\n\
00033 1:      ldarx   5,0,%0 \n\
00034         or      5,5,%1\n"
00035 "       stdcx.  5,0,%0 \n\
00036         bne-    1b"
00037         : /*no output*/
00038         : "r" (ptr), "r" (mask)
00039         : "r5", "cc", "memory");
00040 }
00041 
00042 static __inline__ void atomic_clear_mask(unsigned long mask,
00043                                          unsigned long *ptr)
00044 {
00045     __asm__ __volatile__ ("\n\
00046 1:      ldarx   5,0,%0 \n\
00047         andc    5,5,%1\n"
00048 "       stdcx.  5,0,%0 \n\
00049         bne-    1b"
00050         : /*no output*/
00051         : "r" (ptr), "r" (mask)
00052         : "r5", "cc", "memory");
00053 }
00054 
00055 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00056 
00057 #include <linux/bitops.h>
00058 #include <asm/system.h>
00059 
00060 #define xnarch_atomic_xchg(ptr,v)       xchg(ptr,v)
00061 #define xnarch_memory_barrier()         smp_mb()
00062 
00063 void atomic_set_mask(unsigned long mask, /* from arch/ppc/kernel/misc.S */
00064                      unsigned long *ptr);
00065 
00066 #define xnarch_atomic_set(pcounter,i)          atomic_set(pcounter,i)
00067 #define xnarch_atomic_get(pcounter)            atomic_read(pcounter)
00068 #define xnarch_atomic_inc(pcounter)            atomic_inc(pcounter)
00069 #define xnarch_atomic_dec(pcounter)            atomic_dec(pcounter)
00070 #define xnarch_atomic_inc_and_test(pcounter)   atomic_inc_and_test(pcounter)
00071 #define xnarch_atomic_dec_and_test(pcounter)   atomic_dec_and_test(pcounter)
00072 #define xnarch_atomic_set_mask(pflags,mask)    atomic_set_mask(mask,pflags)
00073 #define xnarch_atomic_clear_mask(pflags,mask)  atomic_clear_mask(mask,pflags)
00074 
00075 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00076 
00077 #include <linux/config.h>
00078 
00079 /* from asm-ppc64/memory.h */
00080 /*
00081  * Arguably the bitops and *xchg operations don't imply any memory barrier
00082  * or SMP ordering, but in fact a lot of drivers expect them to imply
00083  * both, since they do on x86 cpus.
00084  */
00085 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00086 #define EIEIO_ON_SMP    "eieio\n"
00087 #define ISYNC_ON_SMP    "\n\tisync"
00088 #else
00089 #define EIEIO_ON_SMP
00090 #define ISYNC_ON_SMP
00091 #endif
00092 
00093 /*
00094  * from <linux/asm-ppc64/system.h> and <linux/asm-ppc64/atomic.h>
00095  */
00096 
00097 static __inline__ unsigned long
00098 xnarch_atomic_xchg(volatile unsigned long *m, unsigned long val)
00099 {
00100         unsigned long dummy;
00101 
00102         __asm__ __volatile__(
00103         EIEIO_ON_SMP
00104 "1:     ldarx %0,0,%3           # __xchg_u64\n\
00105         stdcx. %2,0,%3\n\
00106 2:      bne- 1b"
00107         ISYNC_ON_SMP
00108         : "=&r" (dummy), "=m" (*m)
00109         : "r" (val), "r" (m)
00110         : "cc", "memory");
00111 
00112         return (dummy);
00113 }
00114 
00115 #define xnarch_memory_barrier() __asm__ __volatile__ ("sync" : : : "memory")
00116 
00117 #define xnarch_atomic_set(pcounter,i)          (((pcounter)->counter) = (i))
00118 #define xnarch_atomic_get(pcounter)            ((pcounter)->counter)
00119 #define xnarch_atomic_inc(pcounter)            atomic_inc(pcounter)
00120 #define xnarch_atomic_dec(pcounter)            atomic_dec(pcounter)
00121 #define xnarch_atomic_inc_and_test(pcounter)   (atomic_inc_return(pcounter) == 0)
00122 #define xnarch_atomic_dec_and_test(pcounter)   (atomic_dec_return(pcounter) == 0)
00123 #define xnarch_atomic_set_mask(pflags,mask)    atomic_set_mask(mask,pflags)
00124 #define xnarch_atomic_clear_mask(pflags,mask)  atomic_clear_mask(mask,pflags)
00125 
00126 #define cpu_relax()  xnarch_memory_barrier()
00127 
00128 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00129 
00130 typedef atomic_t atomic_counter_t;
00131 typedef unsigned long atomic_flags_t;

00133 #endif /* !_XENO_ASM_PPC64_ATOMIC_H */
